sentence: Ms. GILLEN. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on Roll Call No. 306 and YEA on Roll Call No. 307.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION

…1461 was cosponsored by the entire Pennsylvania congressional  delegation, Democrats and Republicans alike. I thank my colleagues for  their support, and I ask this Chamber's ``yea'' vote on H.R. 1461.

…Miller-Meeks      Moore (AL)      Moore (WI)      Mullin      Norcross      Omar      Pingree      Sherrill      Tlaib      Van Orden

Ms. STEVENS changed her vote from ``yea'' to ``nay.''

So the bill was passed.

The result of the vote was announced as above recorded.

A motion to reconsider was laid on the table.

Stated against:

Mr. COSTA. Mr. Speaker, returning from a speaking event downtown and  5:00 p.m. traffic delayed me from making the votes. Had I been present,  I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 319 and YEA on Roll Call No.  320.
